title: PLA in peril: Xi's purge cripples China's military; is Beijing vulnerable?
content: China's military purges are creating significant gaps in its command structure. This is impacting the readiness of the People's Liberation Army. The International Institute for Strategic Studies reports these issues.  The purges are expected to continue.  China's military spending is also rising in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Why Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, xAI, and OpenAI are going to White House in March
content: Seven of the biggest US tech companies‚ÄîAmazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, xAI, Oracle and OpenAI‚Äîare heading to the White House on March 4 to sign Trump's "Ratepayer Protection Pledge," committing to cover their own data centre electricity costs. While some firms like Microsoft and Anthropic have already made similar promises, critics argue the voluntary agreement lacks legal teeth and won't meaningfully protect American consumers from rising energy bills.

title: Explained: How your salary & benefits may change with labour codes and income tax reforms
content: At the heart of this transition is a unified definition of ‚Äúwages‚Äù under the labour codes - a seemingly simple reform that brings consistency and transparency to pay structures that have evolved over decades.

title: Gold, Silver valuation norms: SEBI shifts mutual funds to spot prices; new rules from April
content: Sebi has revamped how mutual funds value physical gold and silver, shifting to domestic spot prices from April 2026, replacing the LBMA benchmark. This move aims for greater transparency and alignment with Indian market conditions. Additionally, Sebi introduced a new scheme classification structure and tightened portfolio overlap disclosures to enhance investor protection and uniformity across the mutual fund industry.

title: SA vs WI: Proteas do India a favour, sink Windies to keep semifinal race alive
content: South Africa secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over the West Indies in their T20 World Cup Super 8 clash, extending their unbeaten tournament run. Disciplined bowling restricted the West Indies to 176 for 8, with a late partnership providing a competitive total. Captain Aiden Markram's unbeaten 82 led South Africa's strong chase, ensuring a comfortable win.

title: Trouble for Chidambaram: ED gets prosecution sanction in 2 money laundering cases
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a prosecution sanction order against former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram in the Aircel-Maxis money laundering case. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling and aims to expedite the pending trial. The ED alleges Chidambaram granted FIPB approval for the deal in lieu of quid pro quo, with alleged illegal gratification received by his son.

title: Big relief for flyers: DGCA tweaks ticket refund, cancellation rules - check changes
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has revised refund norms, allowing passengers to cancel or modify tickets without extra charges within 48 hours of booking. Airlines are also barred from levying charges for name corrections within 24 hours of booking directly through their website. These changes aim to streamline the refund process and enhance passenger convenience.

title: Meet OpenClaw, the AI Agent whose founder Sam Altman has hired paying billions
content: The hottest AI tool in the world, OpenClaw, has sparked widespread security concerns across Silicon Valley. Major tech firms like Meta and Microsoft have issued stern warnings, citing significant vulnerabilities.  Despite its rapid rise and OpenAI's acquisition of its creator, the agent's access to sensitive personal data poses a substantial risk, leading to calls for extreme caution.

title: Tony Dungy‚Äôs 17-Year NBC run in jeopardy as Kelce, Tomlin pass
content: NBC is reportedly set to overhaul its "Football Night in America" pregame show before the 2026 season, potentially ending Tony Dungy's 17-year tenure. The network sought active stars like Mike Tomlin and Travis Kelce, but both appear focused on continuing their playing careers rather than studio roles. NBC wants star presence and a sharper structure. Without Tomlin or Kelce stepping in, the network must decide whether to lean on fresh faces or rethink its strategy altogether. For now, Dungy‚Äôs future stands at the centre of that crossroads.

title: Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda drop first pics as husband & wife
content: Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna have officially tied the knot in Udaipur, confirming their union as 'The Wedding of VIROSH'. The couple, who met on the sets of 'Geetha Govindam', celebrated their marriage with Telugu Hindu and Kodava rituals.

title: 'Nuke rhetoric won't save Pak next time': Army vows 'decisive victory' in future conflict
content: India's Western Army Commander, Lt Gen Manoj Kumar Katiyar, declared the army is fully prepared for future conflicts and undeterred by Pakistan's nuclear threats. He warned any future war would end decisively on the ground, asserting Pakistan's reliance on proxy warfare and misleading its populace.

title: 'No undercover work!' PM Modi meets Fauda star cast on Israel visit, posts selfie
content: PM Modi's meeting with the star cast comes as various stakeholders in the Indian and Israeli entertainment industries have been seeking collaborative projects and possibilities of utilising each other's strengths in various aspects of the creative space.  Last year, amid government efforts to make India a global film production hub, an Indian film festival kicked off in Israel with the screening of filmmaker Kiran Rao's acclaimed feature "Laapataa Ladies".‚Äã

title: Gold in ‚Äòstructural repricing phase‚Äô, could hit $6,000 in 12 months: Report
content: Gold's long-term outlook is bullish, with prices potentially reaching $5,000 per ounce by early 2026, according to MOFSL.  Global de-dollarisation, fiscal stress, and geopolitical tensions are driving this 'structural repricing phase'.  Analysts predict $6,000 in 12 months and $7,500 medium-term, citing investor confidence shifts and supply constraints.

title: 'Priyanka wasn't talking to me': Rahul on how Wayanad helped end sibling tiff - watch
content: Rahul Gandhi shared a light-hearted anecdote about resolving a sibling dispute with his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, attributing Wayanad's "magic" to their reconciliation. He recounted how a planned trip to the constituency, which he previously represented, led to Priyanka speaking to him again after a period of silence, highlighting the special connection he feels with the region.

title: 'We've utmost respect for judiciary': Edu min regrets NCERT book row, vows action
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan assured action against those responsible for a controversial Class 8 NCERT textbook chapter on judicial corruption. The Supreme Court had ordered a ban and seizure of the book, deeming its content objectionable and a potential conspiracy to defame the judiciary. NCERT has apologized and is rewriting the chapter.

title: Strike rate 331.58! Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's 19-ball 63 sends IPL 2026 warning
content: Young Indian star Vaibhav Sooryavanshi unleashed a blistering 19-ball 63, featuring seven fours and five sixes, in the DY Patil T20 Cup. This explosive innings, with a strike rate of 331.58, serves as a potent warning to IPL 2026 rivals. His fearless aggression, evident since his record-breaking IPL century, continues to dominate bowlers, making him a player to watch.

title: Sachin Tendulkar gets emotional as son Arjun gears up for wedding
content: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar expressed heartfelt joy as his son, Arjun, prepares to marry Saaniya Chandhok on March 5, 2026. The couple, engaged in August 2025, recently attended an Ambani event where Sachin shared his pride in Arjun finding a loving partner.

title: Ron Duguay reveals stage IV cancer battle, family launches GoFundMe
content: Ron Duguay, a former New York Rangers star now dating Sarah Palin, is battling Stage IV colon cancer. His daughters launched a $26,000 GoFundMe to help cover treatment and travel costs. According to Page Six, he has been fighting the disease for a year and has undergone major surgeries while continuing chemotherapy and other therapies.

title: 'India need to bring back their aggressive brand': Aakash Chopra's blunt warning
content: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra urges India to embrace their fearless, attacking style against Zimbabwe to revive semi-final hopes. He stressed the need for explosive batting, particularly from Suryakumar Yadav, and criticized the team's current cautious approach. Chopra warned that a failure to revert to their aggressive brand of cricket could jeopardize India's World Cup campaign.

title: Dinners, emails & texts: World Economic Forum chief quits over Epstein links
content: World Economic Forum president and CEO Borge Brende has resigned following disclosures of past interactions with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Brende stated his departure was to allow the WEF to continue its work without distractions. An independent review found no additional concerns beyond what was already known.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo buys 25% stake in Saudi-owned Spanish club UD Almer√≠a
content: Football icon Cristiano Ronaldo has acquired a 25% stake in Spanish second-tier club UD Almer√≠a, marking a significant step in his post-playing career ambitions. The investment, made through his CR7 Sports Investments subsidiary, signals his desire to contribute to the sport beyond the pitch. Almer√≠a's owner welcomed the move, highlighting Ronaldo's understanding of Spanish football and the club's potential.

title: US ups the ante: Warship leaves naval base amid n-talks with Iran
content: The USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, departed Crete as the US increases military pressure on Iran. This move coincides with renewed indirect nuclear talks between the two nations, mediated by Oman. The US has significantly reinforced its military presence in the Middle East, with multiple warships deployed in the region.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold prices dipped in India's futures market on Thursday, influenced by a slump in spot demand and weak global cues, despite a rise in New York futures. Major Indian cities saw a decline in 24K, 22K, and 18K gold rates compared to the previous day, with Chennai experiencing a slight unchanged rate for 18K gold.

title: Watch: IAF offers first glimpse of S-400 air defence system in action
content: The Indian Air Force has successfully completed its full dress rehearsal for Vayushakti-26 at Pokhran, validating all operational parameters. The exercise, set for February 27th, will showcase the IAF's swift threat neutralization capabilities, humanitarian aid roles, and the prowess of numerous indigenous aircraft and advanced weaponry, demonstrating its mission readiness and commitment to national security.

title: Why this mechanical engineer from Bihar chose to become a househusband?
content: Amit Kumar Dubey, a proud house husband from Bihar, has redefined traditional gender roles by dedicating himself to full-time household management. He gave up his job to support his wife, handling cooking, cleaning, and childcare. Despite occasional worries about his responsibilities as the eldest son, Amit finds fulfillment in his role, supported by his wife and family.

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu pose with Royal Enfield bike at tech summit in Israel
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a moment with a Royal Enfield Goan Classic 350 during a technology exhibition in Jerusalem. This bobber-style motorcycle, launched in late 2024, features a 349cc engine and unique styling. The leaders explored various innovations, highlighting the strong ties between the nations.

title: 'Tear gas, torched vehicles': 2000 L&T workers protesting over wages clash with cops
content: Over 2,000 L&T contract workers protested at AM/NS India's Hajira plant demanding higher wages and better conditions. The demonstration turned violent, leading to police intervention with tear gas shells and the arrest of 20 workers. L&T has assured implementation of the Gujarat government's new labor code.

title: Kerala HC stays release of 'The Kerala Story 2', says censors didn't 'apply mind'
content: The Kerala High Court has issued an interim stay on the release of 'The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond', scheduled for February 27. The court observed a prima facie non-application of mind by the censor board in granting certification. This decision follows petitions challenging the film's certificate, citing concerns about its portrayal of religious harmony in Kerala.

title: 'You do not want to expose...': Pathan's blunt message for Suryakumar
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan advises the Men in Blue to focus on winning upcoming T20 World Cup matches. He suggests prioritizing victory over net-run-rate calculations. Pathan also proposes batting captain Suryakumar Yadav at number three to balance the top order, which currently features many left-handers. India faces Zimbabwe and the West Indies next.

title: Why Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift have gone quiet together
content: Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift have quietly stepped away from public view, choosing private time over constant appearances. Kelce revealed they recently watched the Olympic hockey final together and shared family moments during a snowstorm on the East Coast. Their absence from public outings since January has fueled curiosity, especially with their wedding approaching. The details suggest not distance, but a deliberate effort to protect their relationship and enjoy ordinary life away from cameras.

title: 'Windpipes severed': Delhi woman and 3 daughters murdered in brutal attack
content: In a horrifying case from Outer Delhi, a 30-year-old woman and her three young daughters were found dead in their residence, their throats brutally slit. Investigators have identified the husband, a vegetable seller who has gone missing, as the primary suspect. Authorities are probing whether sedatives were administered before the killings, with forensic experts analyzing food samples for clues.

title: Sangma vs Sangma: Watch Meghalaya CM and MLA wife's light-hearted debate in assembly
content: Meghalaya MLA Mehtab Chandee A Sangma questioned her husband CM Conrad K Sangma on stalled livestock education projects, including a veterinary college and fishery and dairy colleges. The CM assured that steps are being taken to expedite the process and fill manpower shortages, acknowledging the large financial requirement for the veterinary college.

title: 'Abusing me and my son won't win you the World Cup': Salman Agha's wife slams Pakistan fans
content: Pakistan faces online abuse after a narrow T20 World Cup loss to England, with captain Salman Ali Agha's family targeted. Despite this, many fans condemned the toxic reactions. England secured a semi-final spot, leaving Pakistan, Sri Lanka, and New Zealand vying for the remaining place, with Pakistan needing significant wins and favorable results.

title: Centre makes sale of E20 petrol mandatory from April 1; what it means
content: In a notification issued on February 17, the oil ministry has said that oil marketing companies must supply ethanol-mixed motor spirit (petrol) containing ethanol up to 20%, in accordance with specifications set by the Bureau of Indian Standards.

title: Men's Power Rankings: Can any team catch Duke?
content: The Blue Devils look like they have the inside track to the top overall seed in the men's NCAA tournament.

title: Source: Scherzer returning to Jays for 19th season
content: Three-time Cy Young Award winner Max Scherzer has agreed to return to the Blue Jays for his 19th season, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Cincy sues transfer QB Sorsby over $1M exit fee
content: Cincinnati is suing former quarterback Brendan Sorsby, alleging he breached his NIL contract with the Bearcats by refusing to pay a $1 million exit fee following his transfer to Texas Tech.

title: UConn wins by 32, Pitino's worst St. John's loss
content: UConn avenged a Feb. 6 loss by handing St. John's its largest defeat under Rick Pitino, a 72-40 blowout Wednesday night in which the Red Storm missed their final 24 field goal attempts.

title: Hilary Knight: Women's team joke 'distasteful'
content: American gold medalist Hilary Knight called President Trump's comment about the women's team "distasteful" but said she chooses to celebrate the women's accomplishments.

title: Third victim dies week after shooting at R.I. rink
content: A deadly shooting during a youth hockey game in Rhode Island last week claimed a third victim, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Quenneville second NHL coach to reach 1K wins
content: Joel Quenneville joined Scotty Bowman in the exclusive club when his Ducks rallied to beat the Oilers on Wednesday night.

title: Banned by NBA, Porter joins USBL's SuperHawks
content: Jontay Porter, banned for life by the NBA for gambling in 2024 and currently awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty to a related federal charge, is planning to play for an upstart pro basketball league.

title: Suns' Ishbia offers $1M to All-Star contest winners
content: Suns owner Mat Ishbia wants more star players participating in All-Star Weekend events when Phoenix hosts next year -- and is hoping to entice them by offering a $1 million prize to the winners of the slam dunk and 3-point contests.

title: üèÄ Kobe, MJ and the black mamba's secret history
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: NFL draft experts preview the combine workouts: Predictions, potential risers and speedsters to watch
content: Which NFL draft prospects should have great combine performances? Who could run the fastest 40-yard dashes, and who will climb boards this week?

title: Why the Lakers' success depends on Deandre Ayton -- and vice versa
content: Deandre Ayton and the Lakers are entering the most crucial stretch of the season. The question is: Will he accept the role they desperately need him to play?

title: Top center fielders: Where J-Rod, Crow-Armstrong, Buxton rank
content: Our list of the elite at every position continues with a spot ruled by some of baseball's young stars.

title: Preview: Who will book their tickets to WrestleMania 42?
content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

title: Who will start at quarterback for the Vikings, Browns and Jets? We made QB1 predictions for all 32 teams
content: Will Kirk Cousins go back to Minnesota? Could Kyler Murray join the AFC? Let's predict who will start for every team in the 2026 season.

title: Ranking the top offseason trade candidates: Who are the best players potentially available?
content: How do Brian Thomas Jr. and Maxx Crosby stack up on the trade market? We break down the latest intel.

title: Wyshynski's NHL trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: How a mental health focus aided John Tavares' renaissance
content: Through his foundation, the Maple Leafs center has driven awareness of the mental health conversation.

title: Latest Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: UCL talking points: Madrid, PSG or Italian football -- who is worse off?
content: And then there were 16. Two Italian giants are out, and Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain only eked through their playoffs. So who has what it takes to win the Champions League?

title: Paris Saint-Germain's Champions League title defense on shaky ground
content: Luis Enrique's defending champs looked a shadow of their former selves, only just edging past Monaco.

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: A unanimous choice for No. 1
content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Fantasy fast break: Has Zion put durability questions behind him?
content: A look around the league reveals Zion Williamson finding the ability to stay on the court, plus emerging options on the Clippers, Kings and Jazz.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Haaland, Rice, Semenyo ... Igor Thiago? Our writers pick Premier League Player of the Year
content: We're approaching the business end of the 2025-26 Premier League season, and it's time to start thinking about year-end awards. But who has stood out? With no consensus No.1 player, our writers debate their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid interested in Arsenal's Gabriel
content: Real Madrid have their eye on Arsenal's Gabriel Magalh√£es, and Chelsea remain keen on Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Kerala moots burning ivory stockpile for commercial use of ash
content: Kerala considers the possibility of burning nearly 13 tonnes of ivory, valued at approximately ‚Çπ260 crore, in compliance with Central directives aimed at disposing of wildlife articles. The ash, considered to possess medicinal properties, could be used for Ayurvedic medicine production.

title: Corporation forms special committee to respond to emergency flooding situations
content: The Corporation insists that the PWD either carry out the desilting work or issue a no-objection certificate permitting it to do so, as it will be held accountable in the event of flooding

title: Microbreweries at notified tourism spots to boost visitor inflows in A.P.
content: Amended A.P. Brewery Rules allow setting up microbreweries within 5-km belt from municipal corporation limits, in designated tourism centres

title: Kerala unveils community energy storage model, positions pilot project in Perinjanam as national template
content: State‚Äôs dependence on imported electricity remains a structural vulnerability that can be addressed through decentralised storage systems owned and managed at community-level, according to a report

title: IISc report on groundwater depletion predicts water shortage in 65 wards this summer
content: Properties in the identified wards that currently lack water supply will be identified and provided with immediate connections, says BWSSB

title: CPI(M) and Congress squabble over whether KSU activists injured Health Minister Veena George during black flag protest in Kannur
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan dismisses Congress claims that George feigned injury, while Congress leaders accuse her of using the incident to distract from ongoing issues in the State‚Äôs public health sector.

title: Thrissur Corporation Budget unveils vision to transform Thrissur into ‚ÄòOxygen City‚Äô
content: Green initiatives, women‚Äôs safety, smart infrastructure and startup push headline Corporation‚Äôs eco-focused Budget

title: A.P. govt. accelerates land re-survey, approves land for clean energy projects
content: The amended Assigned Lands Act will pave the way for clean energy projects worth ‚Çπ10 lakh crore, with a potential to create 7.5 lakh jobs, says Minister

title: CPI veteran Nallakannu‚Äôs body handed over to Madras Medical College for medical research
content: The late veteran leader‚Äôs mortal remains were taken in a procession from the party office through Anna Salai, with party workers lining the route to bid farewell to him

title: Siddaramaiah has failed to ensure peace in Bagalkot, says Arvind Bellad
content: ‚ÄòCongress government‚Äôs minority appeasement policies have emboldened communal elements who are disturbing peace‚Äô

title: ‚ÄòVandalised‚Äô Nehru statue in Assam restored, Cachar authorities say
content: Rajya Sabha member Sushmita Dev had written to the Cachar District Commissioner seeking an inquiry into the alleged uprooting of the statue in Lakhipur

title: Protest staged in Hubballi condemning Bagalkot stone-throwing incident
content: Members of various organisations, mainly Hindutva outfits, take part in the protest organised at Ambedkar Circle

title: Opposition declines to endorse Kochi Corporation Budget amid leak allegations
content: The LDF had petitioned for postponement of the Budget, alleging that the council agenda, complete with budgetary figures, had been leaked and published in newspapers

title: Malkhed PDO accused of swindling gram panchayat funds
content: A former gram panchayat member and social activist Umesh Chavan says ‚Çπ1,55,68,668 have been misappropriated

title: Gauhati HC issues notice to Assam CM Himanta for ‚Äòhate speech‚Äô
content: High Court observes that the Chief Minister‚Äôs statements cited by petitioners appeared to show a ‚Äúfissiparous tendency‚Äù; the petitioners contented that Mr. Sarma‚Äôs words ran against the Preamble

title: Govt. focusing on intra-linking of rivers as immediate priority, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Connecting rivers from the Vamsadhara to the Penna in the State will be covered under this micro-management strategy while the next thing would be the much larger project of linking the Godavari and the Krishna, asserts Chief Minister in the Assembly

title: Coordination among officials essential for development, says MP
content: Tukaram chairs the third quarterly meeting of the district-level DISHA committee at the Zilla Panchayat conference hall in Ballari

title: India and Israel elevate ties to special strategic partnership, vow to soon conclude free trade deal
content: PM Modi said India‚Äôs security interest is linked to peace and stability in West Asia, adding that New Delhi fully supports the Gaza Peace Initiative

title: A.P. govt. focuses on strengthening field-level electricity staff
content: More than 5,500 Energy Assistants have been trained through the Centre of Excellence in Visakhapatnam to enhance service efficiency, says Minister

title: Parameshwara says he will not lobby for Karnataka Chief Minister‚Äôs post
content: Distancing himself from slogans raised by his supporters in Tumakuru projecting him as the ‚Äònext Chief Minister‚Äô, Home Minister G. Parameshwara clarified that he would not lobby for the post, as the decision rests solely with the Congress high command

title: I&B Minister asks online platforms to take responsibility for content, share revenue fairly
content: Mr. Vaishnaw identifies deepfakes and the spread of disinformation through synthetically generated content as major threats to the trust in institutions

title: DGCA makes air ticket refund rules passenger friendly; no additional charges for changes within 48 hours of booking
content: Passengers can now cancel or amend ticket without any additional fee within 48 hours of booking; airline shall not levy any additional charge for correction in name of the same person when the error is pointed out by the passenger within 24 hours of making the booking¬†

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: ED Director arrives in Chennai, to review pending money laundering cases in T.N.
content: Rahul Navin‚Äôs visit comes days after the Madras High Court directed the Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption to register a case on the complaint sent by the ED to the State police chief about huge corruption in the¬†Department of Municipal Administration and Water Supply

title: CBI registers second ‚Äúbank fraud‚Äù case against RCom and Anil Ambani, conducts searches
content: CBI said in a statement that it has registered a second case against Reliance Communications based on a complaint from Bank of Baroda for cheating, criminal misconduct and conspiracy

title: MGNREGS: CAG finds fall in demand for work, person days of employment generated in Kerala
content: Demand for work declined by 13.77% during the 2020-21 to 2023-24 period. As a result, the person days of employment generated came down by 6%. Women accounted for 90% of total person-days, the highest in the country

title: Over 2,000 immigrants verified in special drive against illegal stay in Bengaluru
content: Officials said information had been received about some migrants from Nigeria and Bangladesh allegedly residing in the city without proper authorisation. Legal action is being initiated against those found violating immigration norms.

title: Cash-for-jobs scam in K.N. Nehru‚Äôs dept.: AIADMK MP files contempt plea against DVAC
content: Rajya Sabha member I.S. Inbadurai urges the court to punish IPS officer A.T. Durai Kumar holding the post of Director of V&AC (in-charge)

title: PM sacrificing farmers over U.S. trade deal: Rahul Gandhi
content: At a farmers‚Äô convention, the senior Congress leader promises MSP, storage and solutions to man-animal conflict for people in Kerala ahead of Assembly polls

title: ‚ÄòThis is India, not North Korea‚Äô: Rahul slams PM over action against Youth Congress members
content: "In today's India, under the rule of a compromised PM, peaceful protest has been turned into the biggest crime. The world's largest democracy is being slowly pushed in a direction where dissent is labelled as treason and asking questions is called a conspiracy," Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said

title: 2018 Kachanatham caste murders in Tamil Nadu: a revisit
content: Three Scheduled Caste menvillagers in a Tamil Nadu village were hacked to death during brutal attacks unleashed by an armed gang of caste Hindus in 2018. The latter were enraged that the members of the Scheduled Caste, during a temple festival, had failed to present them with temple honours and were sitting cross-legged in their presence

title: Debt-ridden farmer scales 400 KV tower threatening to end life in Karnataka
content: According to sources, he had borrowed around ‚Çπ6 lakh in 2025 to drill a borewell and, subsequently, he had taken more loans for his children‚Äôs marriage

title: Watch: Is the ‚ÄòHindi majority‚Äô claim a statistical illusion?
content: Chapter 4 of Part I of the Report of the High-Level Committee on Union-State Relations deals with perhaps Tamil Nadu‚Äôs most sensitive issue ‚Äî language. But this is not Tamil versus Hindi.  This is about what the Constitution actually says, whether Hindi numbers are inflated, whether English needs protection and whether India‚Äôs language policy needs a reset. It also challenges three assumptions: that Hindi is spoken by most Indians; migration makes Hindi essential, and the Three-Language Formula is working.

title: Telangana forms Cabinet Sub-Committee for 99-day action plan to expedite governance and policy execution
content: The Sub-Committee, headed by Deputy Chief Minister and Finance Minister, will undersee plan implementation within 99 days

title: Watch: Supreme Court bans NCERT class 8 books with controversial chapter on judiciary
content: A day after taking suo motu cognisance of controversial references to ‚Äúcorruption‚Äù in a Class 8 Social Science textbook, the Supreme Court of India ordered a complete ban on its reprinting and digital circulation. The Court directed immediate seizure of copies and warned of contempt if its order is violated.

title: Union Minister L Murugan inaugurates 10kW transmitter of Akashvani in Shivamogga
content: Union Government to establish content creator labs in 15,000 secondary schools to boost the ‚Äòorange economy‚Äô

title: Vice-President asks students to reject colonial mindset, extols achievements¬†made post-2019 in J&K
content: Addressing the graduating students in his maiden visit to J&K after assuming office, C.P. Radhakrishnan urges all of them to focus on swadeshi innovation and solutions, which are rooted in Indian knowledge, resources, and needs

title: ‚ÄòThaai Kizhavi‚Äô movie review: Radikaa Sarathkumar‚Äôs masala comedy of gold standards signals a commanding new filmmaking voice
content: Radikaa Sarathkumar‚Äôs film, produced by Sivakarthikeyan, is a riotous rural comedy, which blends soul, style and subversion, and announces Sivakumar Murugesan as Tamil mainstream cinema‚Äôs most assured new disruptor

title: Pakistan living in 'la la land', says India at U.N. Human Rights Council in response to Islamabad‚Äôs J&K claims
content: ‚ÄúIf the United Nations Human Rights Council the world‚Äôs highest bridge, inaugurated in Jammu and Kashmir last year, is fake, then Pakistan must be hallucinating or living in the ‚ÄòLa-la-land‚Äô‚Äù, said Anupama Singh

title: No intention to insult judiciary, will take action, says Pradhan on NCERT book row
content: The Education Minister says he is ‚Äúvery sad at what has happened‚Äù and ‚Äúthe circulation of the textbooks was put on hold‚Äù; he says the top court‚Äôs directives will be ‚Äúcomplied with‚Äù

title: 3,000 new buses sought by State-run undertakings of Karnataka in budget
content: He expects introduction of smart cards to help achieve accuracy in maintaining data, and provide precise information about commuters, communities, and students using bus transport

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: Is it propaganda? What Malayalis think of The Kerala Story 2
content: Aastha Jha is a writer at The Times of India, covering politics, business and global affairs. She also writes on social issues, with a focus on policy, governance and their impact on everyday lives. Her work brings together reportage and analysis, tracking developments in India and abroad while examining the broader social and economic currents shaping public discourse. Read More

title: Prosecution Sanction Filed Against P Chidambaram In INX Media Case
content: Probe agency Enforcement Directorate (ED) has submitted the prosecution sanction order against former Union Finance Minister P Chidambaram before the Special Court in connection with the INX Media money laundering case.

title: Golgappa Poisoning, Choking Attempt In Forest: Lover's Murder Plot Fails
content: Every good story has the same ingredients: compelling characters, clear wants and needs, a plot, and a twist. This "love" story from Jharkhand, however, has much more than that.

title: 1,800 Litres Of Hash Oil Worth Rs 200 Crores, 2,000 Kg Ganja Seized In Odisha
content: In one of the biggest anti-drug operations in southern Odisha, Koraput Police have seized more than 1,800 litres of hashish oil worth nearly Rs 200 crore and over two tonnes of ganja in separate raids across the district.

title: Gauhati High Court Issues Notice To Himanta Sarma Over Alleged Hate Speech
content: The Gauhati High Court on Thursday issued a notice to Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma in connection with a bunch of PILs, accusing him of giving "hate speech" and making "communal comments" against the the minority communities.

title: Indian-Origin Doctor's Chilling Call To US Cops After Killing Daughter
content: Months after an Indian-origin doctor was charged with killing her four-year-old daughter by drowning her in a pool at a short-term rental home in Florida, US authorities have released her eerie 911 call reporting the incident in June 2025.

title: Kannada Director Beaten Up With Hockey Sticks, Actor Among 11 Arrested
content: Eleven people, including a woman actor and social media influencer, have been arrested in Bengaluru in connection with the alleged kidnapping, assault and robbery of a Kannada film director.

title: Supreme Court Demands Names Of Those Behind Corruption Chapter In NCERT Book
content: Give us the "specific names" of all those members who helped draft the controversial National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT) Class 8 textbook chapter on "corruption" in the judiciary, the Supreme Court said on Thursday.

title: Video: Lorry Enters Bengaluru Road From Wrong Side, Causes Serial Collisions
content: At least eight vehicles were damaged in a serial collision when a lorry entered a Bengaluru road from the wrong side.

title: Free Trade Pact With India Expected This Year: Israel Envoy To NDTV
content: Israel's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, said that the first round of the negotiations on the free trade agreement with India was concluded two days ago and that the deal could be wrapped by 2026.

title: "Productive Discussion": Piyush Goyal After Meeting US Commerce Secretary
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal met with US Commerce Secretary Howard W Lutnick in Delhi on today - their first since the India-US trade deal was agreed upon.

title: India, Israel Release Joint Statement After PM Modi-Netanyahu Meet. Read Full Text
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Israeli counterpart, Benjamin Netanyahu, addressed a joint press conference on Thursday during the second day of PM Modi's state visit.

title: "We Are From ED": How Help Planned Fake Raid On Her Employer In Delhi
content: It was 10:30 in the morning. Usha Sabharwal was not expecting any guests at her south Delhi bungalow in New Friends Colony on February 11.

title: Inside Bengal's 800-Km "Green Wall" Along Jharkhand Border To Fight Air Pollution
content: The Mamata Banerjee-led government plans to set up an 800-km long greeen corridor, which will work as a "bioshield" - a forested area that would act as a "Green Wall" - along the Jharkhand border to intercept pollutants entering Bengal.

title: PM Modi Unhappy With NCERT Judiciary Chapter, Wants Accountability Fixed: Sources
content: PM Modi expresses displeasure over controversial NCERT chapter, says "accountability needs to be fixed": Government sources

title: PM Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Mutually Beneficial FTA Soon, UPI Will Be Used In Israel: PM Modi
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: "I Owe India": Netanyahu, His Wife And Their 'First Date' At Indian Restaurant
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that he owes India "a great personal debt" because he met his wife Sara in an Indian restaurant in Israel's Tel Aviv. He said the "food was unbelievable".

title: Japanese Funeral Home Offers New Way To Meditate: Inside A Coffin
content: People in Japan are seeking refuge inside coffins, not for funerals but as a form of meditation. It began as a simple, unusual idea by a funeral home in Chiba Prefecture, Japan, and has now turned into a popular wellness trend.

title: Centre Had No Intention Of Disrespecting Judiciary: Minister On NCERT Row
content: Education minister Dharmendra Pradhan expressed his regret today over the inclusion of the controversial chapter on judiciary in schoolbooks, saying he holds the judiciary in "highest regard" and has already taken action in the matter.

title: CBI Searches Anil Ambani's Residence In Rs 2,223 Crore Fraud Case
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday conducted searches at the residence of industrialist Anil Ambani and the offices of Reliance Communications (RCom) in connection with an alleged bank fraud case involving over Rs 2,220 crore.

title: Watch: Yogi Adityanath Experiences Japan's 500 km/hr Advanced Train
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday shared his experience of travelling aboard Japan's advanced SCMAGLEV (Superconducting Maglev) high-speed train, saying the future of mobility "feels closer than ever".

title: 'Hate speech' case: Gauhati HC issues notice to CM Himanta Sarma

title: 'There's not one path': The unexpected rise of Keaton Wagler at Illinois

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .
